page.title: 14Recreation
page.content: The Lindean area offers many opportunities and facilities for recreation,both indoor and outdoor.A public hall built in 1933 and well maintained by public subscription provides accommodation for a variety of indoor meetings and events (p.15). Outdoor activities include horse riding,fox hunting,river fishing, hill walking,canoeing and "botanising".The territories of the Buccleuch and Lauderdale Hunts occupy part of the area;facilities for salmon and trout fishing are available;access to open hill country and old drove roads is undisputed;the Tweed Valley Branch of the Scottish Wildlife Trust caters for local naturalists.Horses abound throughout most of the area and the calendar is filled with dates of events designed to promote the skills of riders and"Show"qualities of mounts
